intro: Hieracium crassiusculum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has basal rosettes of broad, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium crassiusculum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
